ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I highly recommend this course for anyone who actually wants to understand Machiavelli as opposed to his reception in later centuries.
It is a lot of work, but also a lot of fun. The reading some weeks is totally manageable and other it can be a little overwhelming.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Reading Machiavelli's minor works has helped me understand him; as someone interested in the Renaissance this course was crucial and it's helped me come up with many great ideas for papers.
I have always been interested in Machiavelli and thought it was refreshing to study something other than his main works in order to get a fuller picture of him as a writer.
